(4) DPPH Scavenging Method. The 2,2-diphenyl-1-picrylhydrazyl (DPPH) radical scavenging activity was determined using the method proposed by Ahmed et al. [ 30] adapted on 96-well microplates. A solution of DPPH (100 μM) was freshly prepared by dissolving 3.9 mg DPPH in 100 mL of methanol. Aliquots of 180 μL of DPPH solution were added to 20 μL of varying concentrations (3–400 μg/mL) of the extract or ascorbic acid. The microplate was then incubated in the dark for 30 min at room temperature. The blank was prepared as above mentioned without the extract replaced by methanol. Changes in the absorbance of the extract samples were measured at 517 nm using an ELx800 microplate reader.
